website_summaries.verdict: Other sliders are more durable, but you might choose this set if you like the size variety and need the furniture lifter.
pros: A large set (16 pieces) with a variety of shapes and sizes
Smooth plastic side glides easily with most types of furniture
cons: some owners noted breakage after few uses
The furniture lifter is on the short side

customer_reviews.title: Look for something better
customer_reviews.text: The package states that the furniture lifter can lift up to 400 pounds. I used it to lift the corner of a refrigerator to get a furniture slider under it (broken wheel), and the lifting edge bent! It's not made from a high enough grade of steel. Also, while I wasn't buying it for the furniture pads, they are made from very thin, flimsy plastic - nowhere close to the quality of the other furniture sliders I've purchased from other vendors. FYI, the return policy is 30 days, so I was unable to return it (didn't use it until about three months after purchase). Buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roller wheel too small, handle too short and lifter plate too shallow in depth.  Did I miss anything?
customer_reviews.text: Jeeze this thing has all kinds of shortcomings. This is a good concept but badly executed. If it was bulked up a bit it would be a worthwhile tool for me. It's too flimsy. The most dangerous thing is that swing plate that you wedge under the item to be moved. It needs to be an inch or so deeper so you can really get it under what you are trying to lift. Even the pads could be improved. You could use them as permanent carpet protectors under your furniture if they didn't have white backings on them. Paint 'em black guys and they would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The lift tool is good and works fine as stated
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set and another set under a different brand. The lift tool is good and works fine as stated. HOWEVER The sliders consist of a plastic that literally does not slide the way these furniture movers are suppose to slid. The other set I bought I put it under a large piece of furniture and my wife and I where able to easily slide it across our carpet. When we tried the Evelot's sliders we could not move the furniture piece. The sliders are on their way to the trash dump...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This kit is perfect! The handy lifter-thingy picked up the end of ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm just over 5 ft tall and nearly 60 yrs old, so not your average candidate for moving heavy furniture around... Well, hey: work SMARTER, not harder. This kit is perfect! The handy lifter-thingy picked up the end of a very heavy couch for me, so I could put the sliders under the legs at each end... I can move that couch all by myself now... before that, it took three of us to move it ten feet across the room to a different wall. Now, I can move it to vacuum ... or anything else I might need. Great item!
customer_reviews.author: adknative

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless the base of your furniture is nearly flush to the floor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set because it came with a furniture lifter, however the lifter is pretty much worthless for any furniture with more than 1" clearance from the floor. The fulcrum angle is only a few degrees off of 180, and there is no way to adjust it to accommodate for furniture that isn't nearly flush with the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't try heavy stuff
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned the lifter is not designed to lift much. There are work arounds that will allow it to function. I just couldn't get the loaded file cabinet to move across the carpet. The pads wouldn't slide very well. I know I was pushing it but I didn't want to empty the thing (office people don't like inconvenience and I was afraid I couldn't put it back like it came out). It didn't work for me but would be okay for household furniture I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Terriere

customer_reviews.title: Good Pad Sliders
customer_reviews.text: Items delivered on time. Lifter has a very short handle and is great for light furniture pieces. However, does not work well for a heavy chest of drawers. The lever arm is too short so does not provide sufficient mechanical advantage for very heavy items.
customer_reviews.author: ed noneman

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Using this device to move just 3 pieces of furniture (est 200 pounds) to another room, to install carpet, the part of the tool that lifts came off the projection on the lever after moving just 2 pieces (it however was still functional.) The sliders worked, but additional pads were used with the other 4 on the corners, also, 2 of the pads were "squashed" so badly afterward they couldn't be used again to place the furniture back. These "squashed" pads are still usable,, just not with "heavy" items. Overall, It is hard to ascertain whether the functioning of the Evelots Furniture Lifter-Heavy Duty-Easy Moving Pad lives up to its name, because "Heavy-Duty" it is not.
customer_reviews.author: William Henry

customer_reviews.title: The mover pads are fine, but widely available
customer_reviews.text: The star of this show is the lifter, of course. The mover pads are fine, but widely available. The lifter is made of sturdy steel except for the wheels, which appear to be a plastic that does not scratch or mark the floor. The blade that goes under the furniture rotates with respect to the handle, providing flexibility for working in confined spaces. I bought it to lift a heavy antique armoire, and the handle was a bit short for easy lifting, but I managed. I suppose one could use a steel pipe to extend it and provide more leverage, although that would reduce the available lift height. The lifter, combined with some 2x4 wood blocks, did the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Diluted Waters

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, worked great to lift a desk a few inches for furniture risers.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to lift a heavy desk a few inches to accommodate an under desk elliptical. I used this to lift each leg of the desk while I slipped under furniture risers. It was also very helpful to hold the desk up while I adjusted the balance of each leg. This was perfect if you just need to lift something a few inches. I haven't tested the slider pads yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality pads.
customer_reviews.text: The lever seems to be made well. I haven’t used it yet, though. But the cushions aren’t glued onto the pads that well. One fell off as I took it out of the package and the others seem like they are just barely holding on. I’m still going to use the defective one. Being that there will be a heavy object sitting on top of it, I don’t think it matters. And if I think it’s a real problem, it’ll probably be easier just to glue it together, myself than try to return it and find a replacement. Otherwise, the pads allow furniture to move very easily across carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Might work for some, but not me. First ...
customer_reviews.text: Might work for some, but not me. First, the 3/16"-thick lift platform requires heavy furniture flush to the floor to be lifted 3/16" to slide the tool in place. Then the smooth platform and the rollers at the fulcrum allow the tool to slip away from under the furniture before lifting it. One might lift the furniture 3/16" to try again, but the tool slips out again. Quite disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DMW

customer_reviews.title: It works. Exactly as it says.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to move my queen size bed. I couldn’t just slide it around as it’s on carpet. I gave this a try. I moved the bed, frame, headboard,footboard, mattress and box springs on my own. Without help. Using the lifter tool and the slides. This works EXACTLY AS IT SAYS. Moved queen bed from corner of room to where you see it. I moved a very heavy trunk as well. It’s a necessity if you live alone and like to rearrange things once in awhile.

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure About the Rating
customer_reviews.text: We got this to move a large china cabinet, still filled with dishes and glassware and such. Well, it wouldn't budge the cabinet. I couldn't push hard enough, and when I tried stepping on it to lift it, I heard a lot of creaking and groaning, and was concerned that at the very least I'd end up with damage to my hardwood floors. So, we left the cabinet where it was. I'm still giving it 3 stars, and am keeping it, because I'm sure it will come in handy for some (lighter) furniture items. I can't really believe the cabinet I had weighed over 400 pounds, but who knows; I certainly can't weigh it, as I can't move it. ;-)
